page.title: 15Church and Chapel.
page.content: There are three places of worship in Indian Queens.There are two Methodist chapels on the main road and the little church of St.Francis in St. Francis Road.There is no vicar or minister living in Indian Queens,and the Church of St.Francis belongs to the parish of St.Columb Major and both church and chapel are run from there. The tradition around Indian Queens is a strong Methodist one dating back to the time when there were mines working nearby,and following the visits of John Wesley in the 18th. century.The church parish of St.Columb goes back much further to the Middle Ages.In our time(1985) a minority of people go to church or chapel,but those that do work very hard.Recently Jehovahs Witnesses have come to the area.They go from door to door trying to get people to become Jehovahs Witnesses.
